description:
Spaghetti Bolognese with meatballs ($13.45):
Wasn't on the menu this way,  but they made it with  no questions askes. Kids wanted it. Very healthy portion. One of the better meals I've had in a food court and better than some comparable restaurants.

Pepperoni pizza - personal size ($9.95): thin crust. Good but got a bit soggy. Kids still loved it.

Given this was a food court spot I have to give it 4 stars. Meal tasted good, healthy portions and not moderately priced.
author: Tavis S.

description:
I went here for dinner today because I was craving pizza. It's not on the menu, but if you ask for a cheese pizza, they'll make it for you. This pizza was very oily, cheesy (good), and soggy in the middle, but the cheese was sliding off of my pizza. I was fine that it was soggy in the middle because the dough around it was crispy. I thought this pizza was good and I'd come here again to order pizza.

I also tried their penne pasta with meat sauce and it tasted good too, but it didn't soak in the sauce that well and the pasta felt overcooked.

I'd recommend this place if you're having some huge pizza cravings and don't mind the oil, but I just wish they gave me more than one napkin.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Stopped here for a evening snack to hold myself over until I got home for dinner. 

Ordered a half ceaser with grilled chicken and a canned Pelegríno. $11. Not bad. The chicken wasn't freshly grilled, it was cold and it didn't even have fresh grated cheese. Might as well have gotten a salad and sod from Trader Joe's for half the price.

Would come back to try other things, but the salad was only goods; thus three stars. Cashier was friendly and food came out quick...which quick is almost unfortunate in this case since fresh mozzarella and fresh grilled chicken would've made this 5 stars for being a lil eatery in the Westfield dining area. 

Take it or leave it.
author: Alexander H.

description:
My sisters and I walked from Japantown to the Westfield Shopping Mall. We were hungry, so we decided to get something to eat at the food court. Which one shall we dine at? Lobster Me? Buckhorn Grill? Koja Kitchen? The paella from the Brazilian place (name escapes me)? They opted for Buckhorn Grill and I chose Pasta Moto.

I could not do a check-in. My cell phone had only three percent power left and my portable charger was dead. Ugh!!! My oldest sister had to take a photo of me with my margherita pizza and oven roasted vegetables.

The pizza was okay. It was nothing to write home about. Definitely it was not as tasty as the margherita pizza from Tony's Napoletena Pizza in North Beach. Even the tomato mozzarella panini that Starbucks used to sell tasted better. Ai yah! I made a mediocre choice in the food court.

The oven roasted vegetables lacked garlic seasoning. I am not a fan of parmesan cheese in those little packets. I prefer fresh grated parmesan. Overall, the veggies could have been better. I was somewhat disappointed. 

To think, I almost wanted to borrow that line from T-Challa (Chadwick Boseman) in a skit on SNL regarding Karen's potato salad, except in this case it was the veggies. I couldn't burst the employee's bubble and tell him "to keep that bland a** oven roasted vegetables to himself." Instead I asked for a to go box. (Yes, when I arrived home, I threw some minced garlic and parsley flakes to doctor up the veggies.) 

Lesson learned. I will not order the oven roasted veggies again. Return visit? Might, then might not. It was a hit and miss in my book.

However, the employees were friendly and helpful.
author: Carol C.

description: Middle of the road Italian food court food. Chicken with alfredo was all right.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I appreciate Pasta Moto as a lunch option near my office because they offer a lot of the "fun" pastas: farfalle (bowtie), fusilli (corkscrew), gnocchi, etc.

They offer pizza and paninis, but my go-to is always a pasta and a salad. I got the Penne Pomodoro at first - the pasta was kinda mushy and it lacked flavor and sauce. But the second time, I got the Farfalle Primavera - MUCH better. Pasta was cooked al dente. Veggies weren't super grilled, but crunchy - just the way I like it. Tons of sauce to go around.

The service is always great. Even when I'm just getting in line, the cashier lady acknowledges me and smiles as she's helping someone else.

Just one complaint - I ordered the Classic Caesar and added Grilled Chicken. In the instructions, I asked for dressing, croutons, and cheese on the side (per other Yelper's suggestion) but it all came in the same box. It's not super important for me from a food standpoint, but from a service standpoint, it's important to pay attention to specific requests.
author: Athena C.

description: Good portions. Great taste. Regular prices. Everything tasted fresh, except the chicken in the pasta, which was a little hard.
author: Yarissa M.

description: I had the Panino di Pollo with a side caesar. Food was pretty good. Cashier was very friendly. Will definitely come back if I am ever in the area again.
author: Matthew N.

description: I was surprised at how much I liked this place. Because it's in the mall, and I don't like sandwiches. Lol. I tried their Caesar salad and chicken panini. The combination of mozzarella and pesto were super yummy. It's pretty filling, I'm glad I shared with a friend. The salad was doubted with dressing, maybe ask for that on the side.
author: Lynn C.

description: Menu is simple, except the food names are little hard for me to read. Hehe, I am not a spanish reader. Food came out quick and speedy. Great portion side and very filling. I wish they gave free bread.. I tend to have extra sauce left from my pasta.
author: Caroline Q.

description:
We have been to this particular Pasta Moto since long time ago. This review is not for their food. The one star is for the attitude of their manager. The food actually was okay, and it was convenient since it's in a food court, so we can have a quick bite. 

We came here this afternoon (they are not too busy) and we got some pasta. I didn't ask for water in a cup since I had some water in my water bottle. After we found some seats for us, I came back for some water. I asked nicely if I can get some water in my water bottle. The cashier asked his manager, the one who helped us before. The manager said NO. I said well, I bought some food from here earlier. She told me she can't give me water and just go to near the restroom to get water. I didn't even want to waste my time and just said "fine, thanks" and left. 

Well, Madame Manager, I guess you don't mind losing one customer here. She was never friendly earlier anyway and I never expect it otherwise. Seriously, just for a cup of water just in case you don't want to give me water in my water bottle. Enough said, will never go there again.
author: mary k.

description:
"The manager shut it [the tap water] off already."  

Yes, that was part of the explanation, at 7:56 pm as to why they refused to give me a cup of water to go with the rigatoni bolognese that I bought.  

Both the cashier and the food clerk were trained to refuse paying customers free water. 

Pathetic.
author: MICHAEL W.

description: The pasta was good but nothing special. The menu variety was good for an Italian place.
author: Mrs. B.

description: Old yellow pink lettuce on the Caesar salad. Also the cashier woman taking the order was very unhappy with working there. Never smiled and apparently very unhappy to tell us the size difference between 1/2 and full size.  Pizza was fine.
author: Jeanie B.

description: Delicious pasta and pizza!  Great ratio of sauce to pasta and same with the pizza. My WIFE and I were pleasantly surprised.
author: Robinson Y.

description:
This is my GO TO place for Pizza in downtown San Francisco. Can't go wrong here. The staff is always polite and welcoming. 

5 stars. I come here often enough to be a good judge of quality. Thank you!
author: Michael K.

description: I have no idea why I chose to eat here but it was truly horrible. Like it's pretty hard to mess up pasta but they managed to over-cook it entirely and use far too much oil that the sauce doesn't stick at all. Just don't go here, simple.
author: Andrew R.

description: Passing thru San Francisco from San Diego for a couple of days, and made a stop in Pasta Moto. Love this place. Great Customer Service, and the food, don't let me start with the food, we had the Pasta Del Giorno and the Pizza Del Giorno, both were excellent.
author: Samuel L.

description:
I have worked in several restaurant's varying from fine dining all the way to the basic pizza house.
I work in the city and decided to take a trip to the mall and explore the part of the food court I never really go to unfortunately I should've listened to my own advice as when I went in after waiting in what took about 10 to 15 minutes just to order I was given a spaghetti it was under cooked, cold, and smelt like fish entirely. It was literally like eati noodles that some one just dump water and tomato sauce (FORGET about the SEASONINGS).

I'm currently waiting for the manager to give me a call back. I'm very disappointed as this restaurant is literally a reflection of SF culture. How I see this establishment; over priced! And they know it.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Seriously bland food. Thank God they have the salt/pepper/parm/red pepper packets available to doctor their boring dish.

Located in the Westfield Mall food court, they offer really large portions, but don't seem to know how to prepare tasteful chicken or alfredo. The pasta was cooked well, I'll give them that, but that's not saying much. 

Tagliatelle Alfredo (added chicken for a fee, wish I hadn't) (1/5) - creamy alfredo, but not much taste to it. The chicken seemed to have been boiled (too much so) with absolutely no added seasoning. I added an entire packet of salt, and pepper and grated Parmesan, and a sprinkling of the red pepper flakes and it was still just "meh." I wanted a white-sauce dish, and this was their only option, so maybe they're just better at reds. The only saving grace of this dish was its portion. I got two meals out of it, and you can bet that I fixed it all up when I was in my own kitchen. :)

Service was friendly enough, though not too thrilled to honor the free soda from checking in. They've also got some funky buzzers - mine went off twice before my food was ready, and they seemed annoyed at ME that I kept coming to the counter because of it. 
*To-go boxes upon request.

Thank you come again? Nope nope nope.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Ordered their chicken Alfredo. ... and it is fucking depressing. No flavor. Garlic bread is a fuckin joke. I can't believe I paid 16 bucks for this. 

I'm hungry so I have no choice but to eat this. 


Never Again!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
this placed messed up my order

I wanted penne noddles with meat sauce 

what I got was spaghetti with meat sauce 
did not find this out til I got home 

I called and called them but no one ever 
bothered answering the phone  that made
me even sadder

maybe this will get Past Mottos' attention

shame shame on you for breaking a little 
babies heart who wanted her penne with meat sauce
author: Babie S.

description: Honestly have no idea why there are so many bad reviews. It's not the best pizza I've had (can't speak for the pasta as I have not tried it yet) but I've been here a few times when I visited the mall and it was good on both occasions. Service has always been good and prices are reasonable. I'll definitely be back.
author: Brad D.

description: The experience was subpar. Tagliatelle alfredo was decent but probably worth half of the ten dollars it cost. They offered chicken for an extra two dollars but I turned it down. My girlfriend got potato gnocchi with pesto, and we couldn't finish it even with our combined efforts. The pasta itself was alright; my fettuccine was al dente (as they were eager to let me know was the Italian way) and the gnocchi was chewy and decent - better than Trader Joe's or some other brands though not as good as homemade, my girlfriend remarked. Both the sauces were not near the value of their cost, with emphasis on the pesto gnocchi. The pesto was unusually sea-green, and we take their cooks put a little too much blue food coloring in this batch. The pesto was overly oily and blue, which made the whole meal very off. The stall is in a very large food court, so it's not necessarily fine dining per say, but I think there are plenty of other options around.
author: Anthony H.

description: This place made my daughter's friend cry.  I came to Yelp to write this review and saw another review where someone's son was made to cry.  The counter woman was rude, worse than rude, and yelled at the kid (apparently for not being quick enough to hear her number called).  Yelled at the kid!  If you're going to the food court, go anywhere but this restaurant.  Appallingly bad service.
author: Kayla W.

description:
You are in a mall food court, turn in any direction and go eat somewhere else. 

How does a mall court food vendor separate themselves from other vendors?

1. Product knowledge. When a customer asks you if your pesto is cream based or oil based this is not an "outrageous request". Some people on this planet cant eat food with milk or cream in it. You should not over react, or tell the customer its "pesto" and try to avoid answering the question. Keep in mind you are a cashier in a mall food court, you are not the bouncer of an exclusive night club in the City, you dont get to pick and choose who you give good service to.

2. Customer Service. When you add additional items to a persons order, and the customer questions why you have added additional items that they did not order. Do not tell the person that's what they ordered and they have to pay for it. They dont have to pay for it, especially if they didn't order it. It is not the customers fault you are too busy looking at underage boys to pay attention to their order.

3. Make a decent product. For the price, you should try and have food that tastes good, and consistent. Food that cooked earlier then reheated usually tastes that way. Also most people can tell when you are using canned sauces and expired olive oil. The items I have had here previously were "okay" at best. But after today I will be skipping this spot and waiting for the day it gets replaced with a new food court restroom.
author: Paul G.

description:
I don't know why there are so many poor reviews.  My spouse and I have been eating here since they opened.  Sometimes we head downtown with Pasta Moto in mind. He gets the gnocchi and I usually get the cheese ravioli w/small caesar salad.  The price isn't what some would think for a mall food court, but the Westfield is not your typical mall food court.  

Not every employee is perfect, but I'm more concerned about my food quality than I am about how much the person at the counter groveled for my business.  If you want 4 star service, I suggest you don't go to a semi-self-serve spot.   If you want good, quick Italian food, go to Pasta Moto.
author: Robyn P.

description: I did not like the pasta here at all. The sauce was the worst. It did not integrate well with the rest if the pasta.
author: James S.

description: Probably one the worse, if not THE WORST Italian eateries on the planet!  Seriously, this store has no business calling itself an Italian restaurant let alone being open to public - PERIOD!  The pasta was WAAAY overcooked, more like eating a bowl of mush, the meatballs tasted like something that came out of a dog food can, and the pasta sauce was runny and bland.  Please, people, don't waste your time and hard-earned money on this poor excuse of a restaurant.  The mall needs to get rid of this joint entirely!
author: R B.

description: Food was bland, expensive, and tasted like school cafeteria pasta. Needs overall improvement to be worth the price.
author: Lucero C.

description: This place made my son cry. A lady yelled at my son for asking for an extra fork. She did not give us the fork. Service was horrible. Food was average and over priced.
author: G G.

description: Needed quick lunch near where I work, and I got food poisoning. Chicken parm plate was the cause of one really bad night for me. If you must go here, try and get something other than this dish. This experience ruined this restaurant for me and I do not plan on returning.
author: Corinne W.

description: First time, I went to this place, I got the Tagliatelle Alfredo and it was good, Not great, but good. Decent portions as well. Went back and got the Ravioli entree, but instead of getting it with red sauce, I replaced it with alfredo sauce, and it was really good.
author: Jacob S.

description:
Good food and great catering!

I used to come here all the time in high school and college and always enjoyed their pasta! I now order catering here quite frequently for my office catering. Ubaldo is very thorough, efficient, and accommodating! He even delivers himself which is awesome!

Here's what I recommend getting:

- Meatballs - very flavorful!
- Insalata Moto + chicken
- Caprese Salad - Slices of mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, basil leaves, and olive oil and balsamic you can add
- Fettuccine Alfredo - I suggest to add mushrooms, chicken and add some pepper too!
- Margherita Pizza
- Pepperoni Pizza
author: A. C.

description:
This place hasn't gotten any good reviews lately.

I absolutely loved this place! Went here on a Sunday so it wasn't as busy as a Saturday.

I ordered the Panino Caprese, OMG OMG, so yummy! Loooooove it! The salad that comes with it was a bit on the tart side but I could dig it. lol. The meal was a perfect size for me so that I didn't over-eat but was still a satisfied full :)

My cousins ordered a Margherita Pizza, it comes as a little personal size & it was BOMB. Couldn't go wrong with it.

You get FREE refills if you get a drink too :)
author: Camille C.

description: ABSOLUTELY NOT, I went here to get pizza for my dinner and when I got up to the counter I was greeted with an insult from the cashier working at the counter, when I finally got to say what I wanted to order the woman then rung me up for the wrong pizza then what I told her I wanted, I then tell another worker I'd like to get something different than what was put on my receipt the woman then argued with me and said that it doesnt matter, after recollecting my thoughts I then decide to pull my order and go somewhere else the same women then tells me that I cannot do that and that the pizza is already being made, i look at the oven and see that she pointed at a pizza with red sauce and a white sauced pizza that I wanted to order was nowhere to be seen. I then get my money back and the woman starts complaining acting like she didn't know why I didn't want the pizza. I then tell her "Listen, nobody has to be perfect but when I am disrespected for something like this, I will give my money to someone who wants my business" the woman then just starts acting out and tells me i'm fat even though its very obvious she is fat herself and then calls me a fa**** in spanish thinking to herself I did not know what she had said. My advice to anyone who stumbles upon this review is to not come here under any circumstance and there are many places much more worth your money, It is also very frustrating that there is no line i can directly talk to the people who run this establishment so if you have had a problem with these people you are more than likely on your own.
author: Kathryn H.

description: I was working nearby and didn't feel like going to my usual when in the area (Miss Saigon).  I had a pizza from here.  It was a thin greasy crust pizza with greasy cheese and greasy pepperoni.  I wasn't sure how this little thin crust pizza produced so much grease.  The flavors were OK but the excessive grease was very off putting.
author: Joe E.

description:
We tried this place during a recent stop at the food court. We chose this place because it was the shortest line, which may be indicative of the food.  Now keep in mind this is in comparison to some of the other places that kick food court booty.

I had the open-face salmon and capers sandwich and it was 3-star okay. We also got a Thai tea with boba, again, 3-star worthy.

In a rush, def not a horrible place to grab a bit, but with the other options, it would be down the list of go-to eats.
author: Bruce R.

description:
3.5 Stars

Pasta Moto is like a quick service Pasta Pomodoro but pretty pricey for a food court establishment. I had tried the pasta special on Monday which was a chicken alfredo with red bell peppers, asparagus and parmesan cheese. The dish looked very nice like a holiday pasta bowl with red and green colors. However, the dish lacked lots of flavor. It was quite bland to me and hardly any chicken. The whole dish was basically a sprinkling of asparagus and red bell peppers and maybe less than 6 small pieces of chicken. I also got a small soda. Total came out to nearly $14! I would have been better off ordering a gemelli from Pomodoro and a drink and it would have been way better. I will try Pasta Moto again in the future but I will try to find something with a bit more flavor and ingredients to it, not just bland sauce and lots of noodles.
author: Danster L.

description: This is always my favorite place to eat in sf. Everytime I come I get the pasta with white sauce. It is delish! Last time I went I got the penne with meat sauce. The sauce contains beef, turkey and veal. It was delicious as well! The counter help was also really nice. I love this place! :)
author: Tanita J.

description:
This place is pretty ok. I like how they give big portions. I could never finish anything from here. There ravioli was pretty good. I tried their pesto pasta and did not really like it. The lady taking my order asked me if I wanted to change the type of pasta it came it... I should have to be honest. I would go here again, but not order the pesto. I am still yet to try another thing off their menu. They have a big selection which is pretty nice for something at the mall. 

I'll write more once I try other things off the menu.
author: Josephine C.

description:
I got the Pesto Chicken Avocado Panini. (Tasted great!) and the Peppers and sausage pizza.

The pizza was VERY flimsy and the crust was definitely not strong enough to hold anything. I needed to eat my pizza with a fork so that I could eat the crust with the toppings. Folding the pizza didn't help either. That made it a bit annoying to eat the pizza although it tasted good.

The panini tasted great and I'd recommend getting it.
author: Alice H.

description: Way overpriced for a tiny pizza that fell apart trying to eat it. Would not come back.
author: M H.

description: Pretty horrible pizza and very over priced . I hope I won't get sick from eating over there .
author: Zoya M.

description: I just had the most amazing gnocchi ever!!!! This place has amazing food! Whoever is working the register right now is amazing too! I'm allergic to everything and he was really helpful answering my questions! I'll def be coming back here.
author: D W.

description: The crust, cheese & sausage were top quality. I took a bite & my eyes widened, I was so pleasantly surprised.
author: Jim E.

description: Pasta Moto was a little overpriced for the quality of food I got. I had ordered a simple pasta with meat sauce and a side salad, and it added up to $18. Pricey for  food in a mall food court! The salad had a bit too much dressing, and the pasta sauce was bland and just meh. There's a lot of other good food in this mall, and I'll be trying something else next time.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
This place ruined pesto for me.

I went here with my boyfriend a loooong time ago and ordered the gnocchi pesto. After all, how can you go wrong? Those two things together are amazing. And when I was eating, it was great. It was pricey, but it's SF--everything's pricey.

I got home later that day and threw it all up. Pretty sure it was food poisoning, since that was the only new thing I had eaten that day. Ever since then, I can't even look at pesto without wanting to gag.
author: Beatrice C.

description:
This place is okay considering it's just part of the food court in the mall. I got the penne pomodoro, and it was just meh. The pasta was cooked fine but the sauce is just plain tomato sauce. It wasn't gross but for $9, not your beat deal. To be honest, I think store bought preggo sauce is much better. 
The service was friendly but I expected more from a basic pasta choice...after all, it is a pasta restaurant. They do have pizza and sandwiches that looked pretty good but I haven't tried any of them. If you're really craving pasta not a bad place to try, but there are much better places to try in the food court.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Pros:
-good variety on menu
-fresh to order
-great customer service

Cons:
-None

It was lunch time and we decided to come here to eat.  Boy was that a great decision!  I ordered the Funghi Pizza and it was totally delish!  The pizza was thin crust, the sauce was amazing, and the mushrooms were totally yummy.  That and my freshly squeezed orange juice made it the perfect lunch and I was completely satisfied!  Will definitely come back again!
author: J P.

description: Not bad for pizza and pasta in a food court in a mall.  I have tried the Penne Pomodoro and the Rigatone Bolonese both very basic dishes so it was impossible to screw those orders up.  I like a lot of garlic in my pasta so everytime I eat here I ask for garlic to be put in the tomato sauce. The pizza though rather small was okay, a little bland but again I wasn't expecting anything amazing from a fast food Italian eatery at the mall.  It exceeded my expectations because my expectations were low.  They charge extra for bread.  I wish the pasta orders came with bread so I don't have to pay more just so I can dip bread in the sauce which I love doing. To sum it up it was an ok meal!
author: Maria M.

description:
Domo arigato, Pasta Moto, domo...domo
Domo arigato, Pasta Moto, domo...domo
Domo arigato, Pasta Moto, domo...domo
Thank you very much, Pasta Moto
For serving the food that I could make at home
And thank you very much, Pasta Moto
For giving me the runs just when I needed them
Thank you-thank you, thank you
I want to thank you, please, thank you

Rock on, Styx... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io5HHGnemVg&feature=related

Yes, thank you-thank you for yet another medicre eatery in the Westfield Shopping Centre. Pasta bowls, paninis and Boboli-type pizza are the specialties here, and I'm sorry to say I've tried all three at one time or another. Just this past week, I tried the $8 Farfalle Primavera (see my photo), and it tasted like it was cooked about three days ago and nuked just for me. Isn't that special?

There were definitely roasted vegetables in there, but they were so overcooked as to make them almost inedible. The farfalle was far fallen just too moist to call al dente...it was more like al don'tcha. I tried to make dinner of the bowl, but I just couldn't finish it. I almost felt desperate enough to get a Beard Papa Cream Puff. Egad.

"...The time has come at last
To throw away this mask
So everyone can see
My true identity...
I'm Chef Boyardee! Boyardee! Boyardee! Boyardee!"

FOOD - 2 stars...like I make at home...if I used my feet...enough said
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...it's the mall, stupid...the Grand Central Station of frickin' malls
SERVICE - 2 stars...you are just a buzzer to them
TOTAL - 2 stars...pasta cooked al don'tcha...he-he...but Lidia Bastianich would not approve
author: Ed U.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3 Stars

+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Good Selection of Italian Dishes
+ Fast Service

- Pasta was too plain
- Not too expensive

[W] This restaurant is down in the basement of the Westfield Shopping Center. We tried it today because Mona had a voucher to be redeemed before it expired at the end of this month. 

[M] Haha, I lied! :P

[W] Today we shared the F. Primavera.  [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/faYTvRlOy3zK0ypFU7hSRA?select=XooNIndVx4gJnRJJqOKCpA] It was a bowtie pasta with tomato sauce and grilled veggies. All in all, it was a very plain dish and I could've cooked it myself which would've tasted better and I'm not a very good cook so you get the idea of how it tastes haha....

[M] I agree. Took one bite and was like "... It's all yours baby." There were so many options to choose from such as paninis, pizzas, and salad, which all sounded much better than the veggie pasta he chose haha. However, Wayne wasn't feeling too well so he wanted something light and easy on the stomach so Momo will forgive him this time XD

[W] Geez thanks haha. I also order a sparkling orange soda which Mona claimed to be super sour but I was all juiced up on cough drops today so I didn't really taste it. Mona just claims that I "ordered the wrong thing" and maybe I did but I wouldn't mind giving them another try sometime in the future. They had other options available such as paninis, salads, and pizzas. This was more of a fast food spot so there's really no service so it would be unfair to ding them on that.
author: Mona C.

description:
Not bad for a food court, where my standards are pretty low. I ordered the Fusilli Arrabbiata, which is basically just spicy tomato sauce. It was pretty good, though it's hard to screw up that simple dish.

Since I had a Groupon and had to spend $10 in one sitting, I also ordered the "Insalata Moto" (salad) which included goat cheese, pears, endive, radiccio, walnuts, and raspberry vinaigrette, which was surprisingly good. It was quite plentiful even though I ordered a small. Definitely exceeded expectations for a food court pasta place.
author: Adam B.

description:
Aint nothin like La Val!
We ordered the pizza quattro formaggi, which comes with a bunch of cheese without the acidic tomato sauce. The pasta is okay. Nothing else to say.
author: Jerry B.

description:
I had the margherita pizza and garlic bread service was okay the man was knowledgable of the menu and was more than happy to help me with any questions I had about the menu 

Pizza- more cheesy than I had expected but was still nice and satisfying the crust was not too thick but not very thin either and tasted very nicely

Garlic bread- crunchy subtle taste nice side to have along with pizza nothing special but it's a good filler if your hungry
author: Yosef S.

description:
This is quick and easy pizza when you're out speed shopping, on a lunch break or just in the mood for casual napolitano pizza. These days I prefer my pizza crust thin and when I've got a craving for it and need it in a jiffy, I'd come here. They've got several selections from a basic, but satisfying, Margherita to a Funghi (mushroom), and a Del Giorno (daily deal). 

They also have pasta and panini offerings which I may someday try. Despite the name, I'm sticking to the thin crust pizza.
author: Anna R.

description:
Surprisingly good pasta available in the mall food court.  I've had the fettuccini alfredo with chicken, and it's legit.  I've had worse at "real" pasta places. 

Caesar salad is also really good, too.   

One of the stronger choices in the mall food court.  No idea about the pizza, never had it.
author: Jace P.

description:
My outstanding comment would be, "ooh, they've a pretty decent quality for a food court standard." The spaghetti putanesca is not bad. Although I would love my pasta to be on the harder side a little bit, but the sauce is pretty good. Too bad there were just 4 pieces of anchovies on top, it could've been better! 

They range from salad, pasta, pizza, entrees and paninis. No appetizers. In the past, I've also tried their tagliatelle alfredo, pizza margherita, and ensalata mista. If I remembered correctly, I was always quite satisfied with it. Pricing can be a little high for being in a food court, but otherwise, everything's great.
author: Rika P.

description:
Went to Pasta Moto last night. Didn't want the tri tip dinner my friend was getting from the place across the food court. Spotted Pasta Moto and decided to get Italian food. Damn, I was glad I made that decision. I don't know how the bad reviewers like their Italian food but the way it was prepared exceeded my expectations. First off the pizza, although a little small, was cooked perfectly. I'm not a big fan of pepperoni only pizzas but this one was absolutely delicious. Lots of cheese melted perfectly and a delicious crust. I would definitely order this again and also try mushroom pizza.

I saw that they had rigatoni Bolognese but no spaghetti Bolognese. The girl behind the counter said no problem we can make it with spaghetti as well. I expected to get a flavorless tasteless red liquid sauce typical of what you would find that a food court in the mall. But what I got was spectacular! It was a nice thick sauce with lots of meat and tiny cubes of carrots, not just a red liquid. I can eat a lot of pasta and I considered it to be pretty healthy serving. Unfortunately I agreed with my other friend that we split the pasta and pizza so we would each get a some of each. I really regretted that decision. Not only could I have eaten the entire serving by myself but he thought it was so good that we cleaned the bowl out entirely.

Personally I loved the food there and look forward to returning to a try some of their other dishes. Definitely five stars in my opinion.
author: Food V.

description: Over priced mall food and they want to charge you extra for bread with your $12:45 pasta plate.   The added chicken was invisible.
author: Robert R.

description:
(See pic)

More of 3.2 stars.

Came back and had Faralle Primavera after an afternoon of shopping. Maybe I was very hungry, the food was surprisingly good. Lots of tomatoes and veggies, and the pasta was cooked properly.
author: T L.

description:
I took a veggie pizza for about $9.

The pizza was delicious - thin crust, melted uniform cheese (but a bit too much) with veggies and good enough sauce (didn't feel dry). I would definitely eat there again and would try other dishes.

Pizza - 4
Service - 5 (It was the free tasting slice they were offering that prompted me to head there)
Ambiance - 3.5 (It's in a food court in a mall so...)
Value for money - 4
author: Kunal R.

description: Great fresh pasta! Taste's homemade and authentic! We asked for recommendation and ended up with delicious cheese raviolis in pink sauce and pesto gnocchi with a side of garlic bread! It was served in nice porcelain plate ware and real silverware! Best foodcort food. Definitely fast, definitely not fastfood. Wish I could fund nutritional values in food here.
author: elana w.

description:
Though this place is not very cheap, it's in a higher-end food court so you can't really complain. The pasta dishes are simple but delicious, and the portions are quite big. They have pastas, salads, and sandwiches. Service is fairly fast, though lines can get long during lunch and dinner. 

I usually get the fusilli arrabiatta or the pasta pomodoro, both of which are really yummy. Good place for vegetarians.
author: Julia H.

description: Solid italian food.  Always comes out in about 5 to 10 minutes and is fresh and hot.  Great choice for the food court if you want pasta or pizza.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: I ordered the Rigatoni Bolognese with high expectations, but what came out was mushy -- both the meat sauce and the pasta, and too salty. Pasta Moto was a let down and I can't think about anything about this restaurant that makes me want to come back especially with so many other restaurants left to try in San Francisco.
author: Maggie T.

description:
Went here for some pasta before work, which was a huge mistake. I ordered the penne with meat sauce, and the portion was pretty small, which was no big deal, but the sauce tasted like vomit. It was disgusting! It was the first time I had ever contemplated returning mall food, but I was starving so I ate the garlic bread and went on my way. The service was OK, they knowingly gave me a  broken buzzer and told me to wait by the front in case it didn't work, which was kind of annoying.

If you're at the mall, try to go somewhere else... especially if you want some good pasta. Now I regret not getting the meat pasta from Bristol Farms.
author: T M.

description:
01.27.11

Rigatoni bolognese cooked al dente.
Amazing texture and flavor in garlic bread.

Yay.
author: Jenny L.

description:
The food is mediocre, but the service... ah, the service is truly, astoundingly awful. It's no surprise really. They hire vacant little teenage girls who can neither process a Groupon properly (canceled two even though I'd only bought one meal last week), nor take an order. Even though I had just found out they'd screwed me out of the coupon, I decided to pay for a meal with cash. They took the order, I wait around for 10 minutes... When asked, it comes out that they had taken my money without submitting the order to the kitchen. I asked for my money back and left.

You wonder in this day and age how you can find service this bad... If you never encounter these defectives anywhere else, you'll know why. THEY ALL WORK AT PASTA MOTO!
author: Milk and Cheese ..

description: Why does food court pasta taste so good? Seriously. Pasta Moto has some of the most amazing Fettucine Alfredo I've ever had. It's cooked to order and is super tasty! Unfortunately, the takeout portions seem much smaller than the dine in portions, so opt for the dine in portions instead of take out because you will get jipped! Prices are so so, but that's SF for ya!
author: Joyce E.

description:
YUM. Came here the day of the CNY Parade.. SFC was packed to the gills! Anyways.. I was craving pizza, and stumbled upon Pasta Moto. I checked out their menu.. they had about 6 different pizzas. I ordered the ever so popular pepperoni. My husband ordered the turkey meat ball spaghetti. Both were done in fairly quickly. Prices were standard for Italian food.. a bit more pricey then the normal run of the mill Sbarro. 
The food tasted NOTHING like Sbarro. 

The pizza was really oily.. because of the pepperoni.. it just comes with the territory of pepperoni. I liked it. Would I order it again? Maybe not.. I'd try another pizza -the oily pepperoni. 

The turkey meatball spaghetti was pretty tasty. The meatballs were the best part of the dish. There wasn't much tang to the sauce.. but it was still good. I would probably order this dish in the future. 

Oh! We also ordered the garlic bread... don't order it.. it was kinda a waste of $. I don't even recall the garlic taste haha!
author: Alice E.

description:
What I want to say about the food---

--1--Gnocchi in Pink Sauce is still as fantastic as it was 4 years ago. Pink sauce = fusion of marinara and Alfredo sauce. Gnocchi is always cooked through well but not too mushy. (FYI: This dish is always available but not on the menu!)

--2--I had a pizza here once a long time ago. I did not enjoy it. It was super thin hard crispy crust with very little toppings.

--3--Also tried the Gnocchi pesto before..I didn't enjoy it half as much as the Pink Sauce. Personally, I thought it was over oily even for a pesto sauce. But maybe I got unlucky, who knows?

Why it loses a star---Overpriced. The dish came out to be nearly $11 (after tax) for a a medium sized portion.

Overall--Like the many other restaurants in the food emporium--its FAST and its surprisingly GOOD quality. Honestly, everything here is a bit overpriced anyways. So if you're there and feel like you need a quick pasta fix--TRY THE GNOCCHI IN PINK SAUCE!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Holy Crap! Their Gnocchi Pesto is AMAZING. I've never tasted anything like it before! This place is good for a quick bite when you're on the run and the food definitely fills you up. 

Not only is everything well-priced but the food isn't typical greasy Italian food. I definitely wouldn't mind having some of their Gnocchi Pesto right now! :)
author: Sree C.

description: I had a Pasta Alfredo but where were the vegetables. Not even a piece. The pasta was ok but nothing to jump up and down for. Go there if it's in your way but if you take the effort and want something really good you could certainly go elsewere.
author: Magnus B.

description: I had the Panini - Panino di Pollo which came with a side salad. The panini was very tasty!! and the salad dressing was AMAZING. imo, it's a bit pricey for the portion you get but, considering the location I guess the prices are justified.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Their Spaghetti Puttanesca that I tried was surprisingly tasty (sans the anchovy), and I would order this again if I'm craving pasta when I'm at the food court here.  $9.80 for it was kinda expensive, considering it is just mall food, but it seems like most of the places in this food court are pricey in general so I wasn't too surprised.  And what's up with that piece of anchovy that was placed on top?  I don't hate anchovies, but all the little bones in the fish were partciularly irritating and a little hard to swallow, not to mention that it didn't really add anything to the overall pasta itself. 

Also, note that if you want a glass of water from this place, the water dispenser and glasses are located towards the left, hidden, behind the glass display box.  I did not know this initially, since it was my first time ordering from this place and was wondering why they didn't give you a glass of water immediately after placing your order (whereas most other places do in this food court do so).  When I went to pick up my order and asked if I could get my glass of water, the lady who worked there told me it's over there and to get it myself.  It would have been nice if they simply just mentioned this, upon the customer placing their order and asking specifically for water, instead of you having to ask where's my water - but, of course, they expect you to know that.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
Thanks to Mike at Pasta Moto for replying to my last review and giving me a second chance to try this restaurant for free. I'm updating my review based on the margherita pizza I enjoyed this afternoon for lunch.

The guy at the counter was extremely pleasant when I told him the situation, that he had to give me a pizza for free according to Mike, as I handed him the piece of paper I printed out from Yelp. I wanted to purchase a drink to go with the free pizza, but he gave me that free too! Wow, what great service this place had.

The pizza was much better this time around. I asked for tomatoes on my pizza as the margherita pizza does not come with sliced tomatoes as usual. It was delicious, and definitely better than last time. I'm still not going to say it's the BEST PIZZA I've EVER had, but I will definitely come here if I'm craving pizza while shopping-- which is probably often.

I want to thank Mike, and the guys at Pasta Moto in Westfield Center for making my experience enjoyable, and full of quality. These people definitely care about their customers and want to make them as happy as possible, and for that, I fully support this business.
author: Ashley D.

description: I was in a hurry so decided to grab a quick pizza.  I ordered a pizza rustica; ten minutes after I ordered and paid, my buzzer went off.  I thought that was a little fast but I was in a hurry so didn't give it too much thought.  It was a sloppy gooey mess--did not like it at all.
author: C L.

description:
For mall Italian eats it WAS quite good for a year or so. But lately, it's probably the worst Italian cuisine I've ever eaten. 
If you want the worst "bolognese" sauce ever, go to pasta moto. I put it in quotations for a reason, it is thee most bland, boring, low quality sauce you can imagine. 
And rigatoni, al dente? I don't think so. It was so undercooked I nearly broke my molars. 
Seriously, pick an Italian restaurant you hate and go eat there, it'll be better than pasta moto.
author: Troy N.

description:
I can't really complain about this place. I've made a habit of stopping by here on my way to soccer games for the last couple of weeks. 

I've had the panino caprese which I find to be tasty. I order it with prosciutto.

I've always believed that the Westfield mall offers a pretty decent meal compared to other malls. 

Nothing spectacular - but well done and hits the spot. A bit on the pricey side at $9 for a sandwich, but hey, that's SF.
author: Carlos A.

description: Had the personal margarita pizza and it was quite good. Super cheesy. Might want to ask for a fork and knife with it though because the crust was so thin it was hard to pick up in slices.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Expensive mall food meets bad service. I had to wait until the four girls at the counter to finish their conversation before I could order. What's even worse was that the girls were still playing around with my cashier while I was ordering.  Are we still in elementary school?  Are you not aware that you are at work?  

Anyways...the food was pretty good.  My chips were stale but the panini was right on. I don't know if I'd go again.
author: Lisa X.

description: Foods pretty decent but they can't seem to get the orders right. I paid $2.50 extra for sausage and they didn't even add the sausage to it. So if you do decide to eat here make sure they get your order right.
author: Henry H.

description:
I ordered a panini (Panino Verdure) which was decent. Nothing super spectacular AND it was super overpriced but what can you expect out of a food court. $9.50 for a sandwich + a couple of chips + small salad. It's not as much as it sounds. It really isn't...

The wait time was the real pain and reason for the lack of stars. All of my friends finished their food court lunches before I even received mine so it was awkward just eating while my friends watched.

Sometimes there's a worker who has free samples of margherita pizza so I took a slice two times to compensate for my disappointing meal.
author: Stacy G.

description:
This is one of my favorite places in the mall food court! I've tried several different pasta dishes (Penne Pomodoro, Fusilli Arrabbiata, and Gnocchi Pesto) and really enjoyed each one. The servings are quite generous, and depending on how hungry I am, sometimes with even enough leftover to save for lunch the next day. A good price for what you get. The garlic bread is not really worth the money though. I usually end up getting it because I love bread so much, but each time I say I won't get it again, haha. 

My only negative for this place is the friendliness of the staff. One of the first times I went here, I asked for a glass of water and was rudely told that I could get it myself around the corner. How was I supposed to know they had glasses and a plastic dispenser sitting out hiding behind the display? All of the other spots I've been to at the food court give you a glass of water. Also, the staff member who places the food on the trays and buzzes you is not friendly at all. He just takes your buzzer without a word or a smile. One time I told him that I had ordered garlic bread as well, and without a word he turned around, found it on the counter, and tossed it on my tray. I know it's irrational, but I am a shy person and find him very intimidating. So much so that a few times I have opted for Mexican food next door even though I like the food here more!!!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
I ate here twice in less than an hour because it was so good. 

Now, I know what you're thinking: You're looking at the big rating up top and noticing that it's only 3.5 stars. I think people are rating the place based on its namesake--pasta. It turns out that the pasta here is just okay, but the pizza is fantastic. This place should rename itself Pizza Moto.

Anyway, here are the details of my visit.

I was visiting the San Francisco Bay Area with my girlfriend, and we had just figured out the overly-complicated public transportation (we're from LA, so please excuse us) and arrived at the mall food court, starving. I wanted pizza for some reason, so we walked around the food court, looking around, and I settled onto this place like I thought I would.

The plan was to get one pizza (the mushroom one) to tide us over until we could decide on what else we wanted to eat, but we encountered a major problem: the pizza was too good. 

The pizza here is sized for individuals, cut into 8 slices each. Our pizza happened to be topped with garlic, portebello mushroom, and truffle butter, among the usual sweet tomato-based sauce. The crust was paper thin (or, if you're not digging my exaggeration, about the thickness of poster board) and super crispy--reminiscent of pizza from Italy.

We finished this pizza, decided, "Screw the other places; we love this," and then went back for a pepperoni pizza and a Pasta Pomodoro. The second pizza, despite being slightly greasier than the first, was equally delicious, its small pepperoni slices being flavorful but not overwhelmingly salty or spicy.

The Pasta Pomodoro was just okay. We should have gotten a third pizza instead.
author: Eric K.

description: I honestly don't get why people are acting outraged or let down-- this is a pasta place in an upscale food court.  Will it be fantastic? No, it's in a food court, why would you come here with high expectations.  Will it be cheap?  Not really... UPSCALE food court. If you walk around and look at the other restaurant's menus, everything is similarly priced for about the same level of quality.   I personally thought the pasta was ok.  I had the arrabbiata fusilli-- the sauce smelled amazing, tasted good, and the pasta was kind of overcooked.   Given that I was surrounded by annoying shoppers and sleeping hobos, I wasn't really surprised.
author: Bernice L.

description: The margherita pizza is delicious and satisfying.  I just went in today and had it for lunch, and will likely dream about it tonight.
author: Carlos C.

description: Ordered the chicken panini which came with a side of potato chips and salad, the panini had a good flavor, but the bread was so hard I could barely bite into it.
author: Monica R.

description:
I was surprised to see so many negative Yelp reviews about the food served by this place. But then again, I always order the same entree whenever I eat here, so I can't actually comment on the 'blandness of the alfredo sauce' or the 'tiny portions of the ravioli' that other Yelpers have been mentioning. However, what I can say is that I immensely like the item that I always order,  which is the penne. I always request the optional chicken pieces that you can have added to it  for an additional $2.50, which in my opinion is worth it because it helps make the penne an incredibly tasty meal. Another compliment I can pay this place is that my food is always prepared in a reasonably timely fashion, rarely takes longer than six or seven minutes. The staff that I've interacted with here have never treated me rudely, so another thing I was surprised to see here on Yelp were the reviews that mentioned having received rude treatment by those who work there. The older gentleman (who I'm assuming is the owner) always makes sure to politely thank me when I pick up my order. As far as the cashiers, although they don't go above and beyond with their friendliness, they certainly have never treated me in a disrespectful or discourteous manner. 

One drawback to eating at Pasta Moto is the fact that the food court becomes extremely crowded on the weekends. I sometimes come here for lunch on Sundays and it's definitely a challenge to try to find seating. However, that is to be expected taking into consideration the fact that the Westfield Centre is one of the busiest, most hectic places downtown and is naturally always full of shoppers and tourists on the weekends. In order to secure a table, you pretty much have to catch customers already finished with their meals who are gathering their shopping bags and look like they are about to vacate their table. I hate hovering around people who are getting ready to leave, and it makes me feel like a vulture circling its prey, but that's essentially the only way you're going to be able to find somewhere to sit during peak business hours like Sunday afternoons. But otherwise I have absolutely no complaints about lunching at Pasta Moto and it is actually my favorite eatery in this entire food court. 

Although it may seem unfair to give them four stars when I've only actually tried one entree, in my opinion they deserve it at least for the consistency of their food quality since what I order is equally as good each and every time I go. For me personally, consistency is of the utmost importance; when I'm very hungry, I only go places that I know I can count on to serve me the same delicious food that I've had in the past at that locale, and as far as I'm concerned Pasta Moto has proven to be this type of eatery time and time again. Again I can only comment on the penne since that's the only entree I've tried here, so if you're ever in the vicinity of downtown and are in the mood for some good penne, Pasta Moto is without a doubt the place to choose.
author: Tito The Incognito ..

description:
Me and a friend walked around the food court for a while for something to eat. Things looked good but nothing really popped out at us. So we kind of settled for Pasta Moto. My friend got the Alfredo and i got the Rustia pizza. The Alfredo wasn't really good, but it was good for being in a mall food court. The pizza however was pretty jam packed with flavor. I liked it a lot! And if you're a pizza-ranch person like me, the place next door has ranch! The only thing i didnt like about it was that the crust toward the center of the pizza was pretty soggy. So trying to pick up the pizza was pretty challenging. You kind of have to fold it in half, then still hold the front part with another hand. If you don't, it will all sag down and the toppings will fall out. They should work on getting that middle a little more stiff. 

ANYWAY! I digress. This place's pizza is ok. Worth trying, unless if you're a tourist, then there are better places to eat. Prob go and hit up Blondies on Powel street. Its right there.
author: Patrick A.

description: Pretty good pizza for a mall, but not cheap, cost 28 for the pizza and pasta of the day . Were good about letting us make changes to the dish eg arabbiata instead of pink sauce.  Pizza was crispy and tasted good - chicken, corn and mushrooms with BBQ sauce.  The pasta was a bit mushy in my opinion.  Ambience is that of a food court at a mall, what can I say?
author: Vivian W.

description:
I really like their caprese panini. Yum. 

I wish their service were a little faster/friendlier, but overall, it's good stuff.
author: Jodie B.

description: I had rigatoni bolognese and I've gotta tell you, it wasn't bad at all.  Certainly worlds better than Sbarros or someplace like that.   I'd eat there again.
author: Tom P.

description: Let's hear it for the skimpiest review I think I've ever written.  I had a soda; that's it.  But...they were pleasant and gave my friend and I free refills which seemed impossible to get with most of the fast food places in the food court.
author: Robert S.

description: During lunch they would pass out samples of their pizza. Not sure if they don't bother putting the same ingredients or not, but kind of tasteless. The pizza tasted like toast with ketchup
author: M C.

description: I was seriously surprised with how good this place was! It's located in the food court of westfield mall (nordstrom, ground level) Me and a few friends went for a quick dinner last night and it was outstanding. Fresh ingredients, fast service, and kind employees. My dish came out piping hot within 10 minutes of ordering. Made to order, YUM! Highly recommend the primavera. Will be back again!
author: Dario L.

description:
I got a ten dollar groupon for pasta at one of the food stalls at the food emporium below the Westfield Shopping Center.

It was one of the few stalls I hadn't tried yet because pasta is so easily had.  It was interesting.

First, there wasa tussel between the servers to take my order.  Did I smell? Did I have a live chicken on my head?  I don't know what the problem was but I got the food to go and it was alright.  I got the fettucini alfred (which was under another name but it was f.a. nonetheless).

The food was not bad.  The added chicken was bland but it was fast and plentiful.  That's all there is to say about them.
author: lily l.

description:
Had a Groupon so we decided to try it out. I ordered the Arrabbiata. It was excellent. I was a bit taken back how spicy it was but once the shock was gone, I really enjoyed it. I just wished it came with bread already. It would have helped my taste buds.

Will definitely return again.
author: arleen r.

description: Has anyone ever gotten food poisoning from here? I did. It sucked. Highly recommend you stay away. I ordered the Panini di Tacchino. It didn't taste very good and I didn't eat much of it. Still was sick for a day starting about 2 hours after I ate it. Bad bad bad.
author: Bella T.

description:
The Food Court in the SF Shopping Center is quite deceiving. The seemingly myriad choices aren't quite as numerous as one would assume, especially upon my lunch routine elimination-tactics:

1. I despise Andale. The WORST and most overpriced Mexican food ever.
2. Never want to deal with the long lines at Sorabol.
3. Hate the Sausage place (see my scathing review of the Emeryville location).
4. I will not pay $6 for a cup of soup at the SF Soup Company.

Therefore, I am often left with Pasta Moto as my go-to spot. And this is not a bad thing. Pasta Moto is a solid 4.5 stars, in that things are, as Yelp's rating system indicates, "Yay! I'm a fan," but bordering on "Woohoo! As good as it gets!"  The food is tasty, it is made fresh, and the menu has many offerings.

This last visit, I had the Rigatoni Bolognese with mushrooms. My addition of the fungi made my total a whopping $11.22. To me, anything over $10 is outrageous, but this time I wasn't shaking when I handed over my $20. It's because I know I will have leftovers. Always do. Pasta portions are generous and it easily gives me enough for a second meal. So really, my meal cost $5.61. 

To boot, the workers are pleasant and helpful (a combination you will have trouble finding at most food courts) and entrees come with a side of tasty garlic bread. I've tried salads, pizzas, and pastas here and everything has been fine. 

Domo Arigato, Mr Pasta Moto!!! (You like that? I'm even cross-cultural!)
author: A A.

description: Don't think I would come here again. The alfredo was a little bland and the gnocchi was really gummy. The only plus was the pesto sauce. That was delicious, but not enough to get me to come back.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
Really good pasta and friendly service (minus a mistake)

I had the spaghetti puttanesca, which was waaay beyond my expectations, not just for mall food, but in general. Reminded me of Mona Lisa in No. beach. Fresh, well flavored and even fresh anchovies. The serving even left me with leftovers. I ordered it again 2 days later and ditto. 

Con: I identified dairy allergies and despite the cashier even though the cashier said no dairy was in my meal, they managed to blend in cheese. Baaaaaaad! Allergic rxn = swelling of throat which = ER. No apologies from cashier.  Luckily I always double check my food!

I'd come back, but they def want to avoid the above... someone not as understandng could literally sue and win.
author: Jason N.

description:
Yup mall food, and yes that is four stars you see. It lives up to its slogan " Fast food with restaurant quality."  Everytime I'm in this mall I stop by Pasta Moto to bring home for dinner. The food is so quick and it's criminal that it's also so tasty.

I always get the penne pomordoro with sausage.  I suspect they use San Marzano tomatoes, but that could be a wish more than a truth because their Pomodoro sauce is better than most expensive restaurants in SF. I always request to add the sausage, because it just adds an extra kick. The sauce is flavorful and comforting, and it just sets me straight after a bad day at work. The penne is just way I like it. Al dente. Take that Sbarro for your endless years of cruelty! 

Although the yelp pictures of  the Pesto Gnocci is looking kinda sexy right now. I might just have to cheat on my regular dish.
author: Christina Y.

description: I have eaten at this Pasta Moto before at the Westfield Shopping Mall At the San Francisco's Downtown Area... The pasta item that... I have ordered & eaten at this Pasta Moto at the Westfield San Francisco Downtown Area was the RIGATONI~ BOLOGNESE Meat Sauce which tasted really good when the very first time... That, I have eaten it!!!!
author: William B.

description: Earlier today I went to Pasta Moto and ordered some Ravoli with meat sauce and I was disappointed the Ravoli was an small portions in a big bowl WTF!!! I'm a 147lbs person with a big appetite and they are serving me a portion for a person on a diet. I'm not on Weight Watchers I felted robbed out of my portions of the food even thought the food was delicious but the portions could been larger size.
author: Chris Ackord P.

description:
I think the pizza is pretty decent considering it is mall food. The margherita is probably my favorite, if I had to choose. I can't say the same for their pastas but I do recommend staying within the tomato-based dishes; their alfredo isn't great. It's one of those dishes that you get bored with really quickly. It's also very dense and heavy - which made me sick, but that's just me since I'm really sensitive to a lot of foods.

Pasta Moto is good if you want to satiate your Italian cravings with something relatively average-priced, higher quality than other Italian mall eateries, and want something quick.
author: K. E.

description: I got the Insalada Moto for $4.50.  Overall it was a pile of finely cut lettuce, mixed with the dressing.  Pears on the sides and cheese balls of goat cheese.  It looked really good, but didn't make me crave another one, if that makes sense.  Their pastas were on the pricey side, which is why I didn't get one.  Hello...$8.50 for food court food!??  No thanks.
author: Michelle M.

description: The panini mozarella tomato sandwich is ok.
author: Gopi V.

description: Worst experience here ever! They must have changed ownership because all of the workers there barely speak any english. I called to place an order over the phone and the supposed manager tells me to hold on, and then hangs up on me. I get there to pick up my order and they tell to cook to get it started and I see him open a pre-made package and the chicken was under-cooked because they tried to hurry to cook it. I asked the guy what the point of me calling was if my food hasn't even been started on, and he gives me attitude like if he wants to fight or something, asks me if I want the manager, and then another short little guy who barely speaks any english comes out and also tries to act tough with me. The manager did nothing at all, just defend his employee. They really need to get a whole new line of new hires, because this is a joke. Never coming back here, and wouldn't recommend to anyone.
author: wayz W.

description: 3.5 stars. I was looking for a convenient place to grab food to go after getting off the Powell stop of BART.  I had to be outside in 15 minutes and there is no fast food type joints inside the SF Shopping Center. We had to be at a show and we were pressed for time and knew we needed to eat before the 8 oclock show that would most likely let out after 10PM.  There's not really anything easy to take to-go and fast from inside the food emporium either...  but I spied with my little eye paninis in the food case and decided that was what I was going to go with.  I ordered a prosciutto and a pollo panini to go thinking they'd probably just have to press it and ta-da I'd be done and ready to go but I still had to wait a good 10 minutes for it to be done.  I was getting hungry seeing all the pastas coming out before my order.  My hubby who I was meeting outside actually had to circle the block a few times because it took awhile.  As soon as it was ready, my pager buzzed and I grabbed the food and ran.  We ate in our car... how romantic... but it ended up actually being really good!  It came in a small box, so I thought it would just be the paninis but there was a salad tossed in balsamic vinagrette with tomatoes too and potato chips.  A perfect sized meal.  We split the sandwiches and got to try both.  The chicken was the better one in my opinion, it had slices of chicken breast, avocadoes,  mozzarella, and a pesto sauce.  The prosciutto had a lot of prosciutto inside, but for some reason it was really mushy.  I think it was just prosciutto, tomatoes, and greens.  All in all it was a pretty good dinner!
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Pasta Moto should change its name to"Pasta No No".  Or...."Dana, why do you come here when you know you don't like it and you're disappointed every time"

I think that pretty much sums it up.
author: Dana C.

description:
We are San Francisco and we have to have a fancy mall with a snooty food court just to show how much better we are than you.

Pasta moto serves tiny portions of undercooked pasta.

I'll take SBARRO over this any day.
author: Manny F.

description: The male cashier greeted me with a smile at first, but frowned when I asked him how much the "mama spaghetti" was -  one of the least expensive in the menu, which made me wonder if he was thinking "crap, a cheap customer." I got my order in a timely manner, which was good. However, the spaghetti was tasteless and the spaghetti was floating helplessly in grease. Maybe that is how an authentic spaghetti is done? I don't know, but I definitely regreted spending $13 for a meal that is not worth a penny.
author: Jewelicious O.

description:
I am giving this 4 stars because as a mall food establishment this place is awesome. Sure the pizza can be greasy and you may need to blot it before you eat it, but seriously, the crust is light and crunchy, the toppings are fresh and tasty and and it's ready in a very reasonable amount of time. 

I've been here twice now. I've had the margherita pizza and the 4 cheese pizza. Both are quite tasty, though I prefer the margherita. The four cheese has gorgonzola, ricotta, mozzarella and perhaps fontina? I can't remember the 4th cheese, but it was delightful. We also got a side of their roasted vegetables and while they had a tad too much oil on them for my taste, they were also very good. If I am shopping in union square I would not hesitate to stop here again.
author: Kristen M.

description:
what i ordered... pepperoni pizza

...the pie was good though it was too light a 10 year old kid could finish it up easily, it was about 9-10" in diameter got a very very thin dough just like a cracker yet soft enough to fold, it had enough cheese and sauce, and the pepperoni topping was so similar in taste and look as that of the hormel brand at safeway.

ambiance... good (hey, this mall has the best dining area compared to others.... that is if you could find an empty table)

cost... $$
author: Gors P.

description:
This place is pretty damn good for a mall food establishment. 

This place is pretty damn expensive for a mall food establishment.
author: Jen D.

description:
Im not fond of pizza or pasta for lunch, so I came here for the salad.  I ordered a half order of Insalata Moto.  Its only $4.50 and it was pretty big.  and mighty tasty.  It came with mixed greens, walnuts, goat cheese and pears.  yummy.  

and I also got an order of Garlic bread.  For $1.50 you get 6 pieces... all of which has actual pieces of garlic on them.  I wont be talking to anyone today.
author: Janet S.

description:
Just an "eh".  Nothing special about this place.  The portions are very small for the price.  Must be they charge extra in all the eateries here, because everything is served on actual ceramic plates, and you don't have to bus your own table.

Anyway, I ordered 4 dishes for friends to go.  I had the Amatriciana, which needed more pancetta.  I had to add hot peppers to make it the way it should be.  Also had the cheese / spinach ravioli with tomato basil sauce, which was pretty good.  The pomodoro pasta was good.  Also ordered the Rigatoni with meat sauce, but there was not much meat in it.  The two best ones I tried was the ravioli and the pomodoro

Service is very slow, and they tried to give me 2 orders of pasta when I ordered 4.  True, they did correct it, but if you are not paying attention, that is a problem.  The staff seemed very rushed to get everything done.  True the place just opened, and maybe give them time to get the kinks worked out.

Pizzas are also available, but still seemed small.  The sandwiches looked good in the case, but nobody was ordering them.  They all come with arugula.  NEXT!!
author: Michael M.

description:
Tastes exactly like you'd expect Italian-style mall food to taste like, keep that in mind and you might not be so disappointed. 
I came here after a late night movie, and passed up a packed zazil, in favor of a quick bite. The salad left a bad taste in my mouth, the artichokes tasted canned (in a gross metallic kind of way that had me begging for something sweet, and actually gave me a stomach ache) , and pasta sauce was kind of bland and boring. The only redeeming quality is the really friendly service, the late hours, and convenience, which pretty much sums up why people might go here. As for me, I don't think I'll try them anytime soon.
author: X marks the spot ..

description:
I think this is one of the best food courts I've been to. Although I can't imagine having a teenage kid, and them going here and eating 10- 15 dollar meal and calling it "mall food". Mall food was different in my day: Icees and Sbarro's pizza or Taco Bell topped off with a Mrs. Field's cookie. What happened?!? Now their choices are Askew Grill, Bristol Farms and Beard Papa's! Kids are spoiled now, I tell ya!

Anyways, before we stopped over to our friend's housewarming party in beautiful Western Addition, we stopped at the Westfield Mall to pick up a housewarming gift at Bloomie's and picked up a quick dinner at Pasta Moto. We ordered the mushroom pizza and the caprese salad.  Decent meal, pizza was surprisingly good, with big cloves of garlic thrown on top. The caprese salad was so-so: the tomatoes weren't all that, hard and flavorless. 

Total: $21.00 for 2 dishes, one limonata and tax and tip.

I guess that's not that bad. But it ain't no Sbarros pizza by the slice for 3 bucks!
author: Caroline C.

description: Excellent Margherita pizza done in a wood-fired oven. Price is OK for mall food in high end part of town.
author: BB H.

description: Tasty Pizza and salad (Insalata Mista salad dressing is yummy). :-)
author: Robyn M.

description:
I spend a good portion of my afternoon sick as a dog thanks to this place and their singular veggie panini. 

THUMBS DOWN.
author: Lindsay D.

description:
Mall food court food done right.  Not only is the food actually good, but the service is super friendly and fast, and totally on it.  Yeah, I'm a sucker for being called "bella" even if I think the accent is affected and know damn well they call EVERYONE bella.  They were slammed when I was there, but never acted stressed out or jerky.  They still got everyones orders right and were happy the entire time.
I had the prosciutto/goat cheese panini which was good.  It came with a side salad and some chips, which I wish I would've known since I also ordered a half salad.  Next time I'll ask for the dressing on the side though as it was too overpowering for me.
I have a new go-to food spot in the food court beyond my teenage years.  Whodathunk it?
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Two words: Mall pasta. Blech. Got the gnocchi pesto - gnocchi was over cooked and store bought meaning it came out mushy and pasty. Pesto was thin and not very flavorful. For 8.50? I could make a better pesto gnocchi dish at home.

Why two stars? The guy behind the counter called me bella and kept saying how beautiful I was. What can I say? I'm a sucker for flirting with guys who serve my food.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Alright. Service was friendly & fast, food was tasty. 

Trying to carbo load, so I got the the curly pasta with meat sauce.  I mean it's hard to screw up pasta but it's hard to knock it out of the park as well. It's what: water, flour and some pasta sauce and boiled? Even I can cook it at home! Prices were in line w/ the food emporium, $9/dish.
author: Jennifer K.

description: I'm updating my rating from four to five stars!  The service here is great, I love the food! I picked up my regular ravioli with mushrooms yesterday as well as a caprese side salad and it was delicious!  This is definitely one of the best places in the mall food court.  Highly recommended.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I recently visited pasta moto by a client suggestion when I was in the area.  At first I was disappointed to be in a mall food court, but then I tried the special of the day, some sort of mushroom pasta, which was delicious.  The ordering was quick and easy and I really liked the variety of the menu.  I will have to get back and try the pizza sometime.

This is a great place to stop by on a day of shopping, or even take a client out to a casual lunch with great people watching!
author: Eric M.

description: Ok for a quick Arrabbiata at lunch, but beyond that, it's mall food.
author: Scott M.

description:
Pasta Moto is a small Italian "fast food" restaurant which offers pizza, pasta, and paninis. My girlfriend and I got a spicy pasta dish and a small cheese pizza, both of which were excellent. The food was very reasonably priced, and the portions were large enough to split. They even offer free drink refills, a first for any mall food court I have visited. 

Mall food is generally a gross affair, especially somewhere like Hot Dog On A Stick or Panda Express, but Pasta Moto is a step above the rest with quality food and affordable dishes. I would definitely recommend it.
author: Devon H.

description:
This is an eatery in the newly renovated San Francisco Center.  I ordered the Panino Pollo (panini sandwich) and was disappointed.  The sandwich didn't taste special.  The bread tasted like it was toasted by a toaster, not a panini grill.  For the $7.75 price, before tax, it came with a tiny mixed green salad (no dressing).

The employees were friendly but the service was slow!  I ordered at 11:30am (before lunch rush), but had to wait 10 minutes for my sandwich.  Please note that the sandwiches are already pre-made and just need to be put on a panini grill.  I asked for the sandwich to go but they made it for eat in.

FYI: I saw the pasta dishes and the portions looked small for an dishes with an average price of $8 with no side of bread or salad.
author: Judy T.

description: The food is good but the service is not.  When we tried to get sited at the table we gently offered to clean the table (which we did).  When I left the dirty dishes at the counter, the cashier person a tall heavy Asian male raised his voice.  I did not appreciate the way he talked to us.  This is the reason why I don't recommend the place because of the rude staff.  If you want to eat good Italian food go to the self service at Bristol market.  You will not have to endure this type of treatment.
author: Lutecia s.

description:
UPDATE- My original review highlighted a couple of misspellings on PM's menu, but I've since heard back from them (seem like really good people, y'all) and the spelling errors were simply a goof.  New menus w/correct spelling should be coming sometime soon.  Even though I'm usually wary of misspelled Italian dishes, I was really in the mood for a pizza, so I tried one out.  Really tasty!  The soda fountain machine was broken though (hey, it happens) but no, grazie, I don't want to opt for the aranciata that's the size of a nail polish.   So the rating is primarily for the tasty pizza, which I'll definitely try again.  Pasta dishes looked great too but I haven't tried any yet.
And PS to the other yelpers complaining re:paltry size of the pasta dishes- I know we're in the YouEssUvAy, but in Italy, pasta isn't served in gargantuan-size bowls.
author: Kate K.

description:
The Panini Di Pollo is decent. It's not the greatest panini I've had - they should seriously consider adding sun dried tomatoes (or anything with some zing) in addition to the chicken, mozzarella, pesto and avocado otherwise it's a bit bland but not a bad bland. I really liked that the sandwich was served with a simple arugula salad and kettle chips. The chips were unexpected but really set off this quick meal.

Oh, and why is this categorized under "pets" and "car wash??"
author: O'Shea J.

description: Food was disgusting...came here during the lunch hour rush and ordered the pasta dish with spicy tomato and added chicken, sausage and a soda. The tab came out to be about $17.  The chicken was very tough, even the sausage.  Something tasted very gammy.  Portions are large, but not worth the $.  It took me about 15 minutes to get my food.  Pasta that takes this long should be hot; it came out warm.
author: TC L.

description:
The only time I come here is to order their side of grilled vegetables because it's so cheap! Only $3 or so.

The pasta itself doesn't look that great though. I haven't tasted it myself, but just judging by how it looks on other people's plates.

I do suggest the grilled vegetables though, and it's probably a healthier choice.
author: Xavier G.

description: This was the only place in the food court that had freshly squeezed orange juice.  They actually have this machine where you put the whole oranges in and they make it fresh.  It was very good & sweet.  Didnt get to try anything else there but based on the orange juice, I'll give it 4 stars.
author: Di L.

description:
I seem to be doing a lot of four star reviews lately and I consider this a testament to my fine skills in selecting excellent places to eat rather than an over generous opinion of the restaurant scene in Northern California.

I work in the offices above the Westfield Centre so I am slowly working my way through the food court for lunch.  As it is an 'upscale' emporium there isn't a Sbarro to be seen anywhere and I can honestly say that Pasta Moto is everything that Sbarro wishes it could be.

As Italian as Marlon Brando riding a Vespa, this place serves pizza and pasta that would not be out of place at La Westfield Centro, Naples and that is a good thing.  The owner is often stationed at the register doing everything to bring together American-Italian relations by handing out free drinks to pretty girls and discount pasta to those that work in the centre.

Service aside the food is delicious and given I've eaten a lot of Italian food in Italy I can vouch for it's authenticity.  The pizzas are hand tossed from fresh dough and then baked very very quickly to ensure the right balance between crisp and chew.  The pasta is perfectly portioned for a pre-gym meal (not too much) and delicately flavoured and EXPERTLY SEASONED.
