My pet peeve as you might know reading my reviews is restaurants in Cali that think salt is evil.  Pasta Moto doesn't.  So please forego the Sbarro prejudices and give this lot a go, they serve great food at slightly high prices. :)
author: Tony S.

description: For mall Italian food, it's pretty impressive. To have the best value and taste experience I suggest ordering any of the panini sandwiches (they come with a side of potato chips and salad), the puttanesca or arrabiata pastas, and if you don't mind splurging on add-ons, add sausage or veggies to your pasta dishes and a side of garlic bread. I often have large enough portions to take home for another meal.
author: Elaine W.

description:
you really can't go wrong with this place. i must applaud westfield for picking the non-regular mall food. yes, so there is a sbarro on the other side and a panda express, but the choices on this side is great! some are way too pricey but not pasta moto.

everything is really fresh, made to order i think. the pasta is NEVER over cooked and not drenched with sauce. the gnocchi is really delicious too, not too powerful with pesto.

thumbs up: pasta, pizza 
thumbs down: lame big screen tv advertising its menu options. its kinda tacky.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I really like their Fusili Arribiata. I love Arribiata, so spicy and zesty and stuff. I think their portions are just fine for the price. You're paying a little extra for the privilege of having decent food at the mall. I'm totally fine with that. You need energy to shop, carbs=energy. I also love carbs.

I've always been pleased with the service here, I only wish they were still open when I get out of class after 9 pm. Learning makes me hungry.
author: Christine K.

description: After watching Eat Pray Love I needed some sort of Italian fix.  My kids and I went to the city to meet my husband for a quick lunch and everyone wanted something different so we decided that the food court at San Francisco Center is the best solution for everyone.  I decided to give their Pizza Funghi a shot.  To my surprise it was actually good.  Nice thin crust, not overly tomato-y and a thin layer of cheese topped with a thin slice of portobello mushroom and roasted garlic.  I LOVE garlic so this was a great addition.  They also had fresh parmesan cheese too. I would def come back here next time if I want a quick pizza fix and I am in the center doing some shopping.  Maybe even try a panini :)
author: Tammy N.

description:
Why oh why do I keep wanting to eat their pasta.  Met my honey for lunch today at the SF Centre food court. I had Korean on my mind but at the last minute i saw pasta. 

Yea me want Pasta!

Ordered their rigatoni with meat sauce.  Didn't realize that I had already ordered this once  it until the dish was in front of me. Doh! I wasn't impressed with it the first time. Yet again not impressed. Maybe if it was $5 instead of $8.50 then i wouldnt feel so disappointed.

Damnit brain, you failed me yet again! I gotta stick with the tummy from now on.
author: Mary L.

description: I have two groupons that expire March 13th. If you would like one please send me a message and I can email them to you. I purchased them when we went on a trip out there but I live in Texas. They are FREE! Just don't want them to go to waste!
author: Rosie M.

description: It's quick fresh-cooked italian at the mall. Can't really expect more than that. It doesn't get too terribly busy, which means sometimes staff sometimes forget to check if a customer walks up to order. It's an alright meal that can fill you up or leave you wanting more depending on what you order.
author: Cory M.

description:
For what it is, Pasta Moto is a pretty decent place to grab some lunch. Located in the food court of the Westfield Mall, this place is pretty busy come lunch time. If you go around lunchtime and in a group of more than 2, good luck fighting for a seat with the other lunch go-ers. 

When it comes to pasta, I tend to stick to a few basics. One of them being Fettuccine Alfredo. So, both times I have gone here, I ordered this and added some grilled chicken to it. I have to say, the alfredo sauce was very good. It was made from a light cream sauce, so it doesn't sit like a brick in your stomach after wards. They add parmigianno reggiano, cracked black pepper and the portion size is just about perfect. I think some fresh basil would make this dish even better than it already is. 

Next time, if I am feeling daring, I MIGHT try something different. :)
author: Jason B.

description: I ordered the Ravioli con Spinaci e Ricotta (pasta stuffed with ricotta cheese and spinach, with tomato basil sauce). The portion was so small for the near $9 I paid. I was still hungry afterward. I can get a more-filling, better priced bowl of pasta elsewhere. I might come back and try their panini instead. Hopefully that will amaze me more.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Their pizza was pretty good.  They do serve alcohol in the mall!  That was pretty cool.  The people were nice and the food didn't take too long to come out.  They gave us the wine immediately.

This lead to stumbling around tipsy in Union Square while trying not to drop any gelato on ourselves.  A good time.  Thanks for serving alcohol in the mall Pasta Moto.
author: Patrick T.

description: I went here after reading the good reviews on Yelp. The food was good and the service was fast. It's not very cosy though (being in a food court).
author: Yoni D.

description: I am vegan and the girl said they don't have eggs in their pasta which I was super happy about- then I had the pasta with marinara or tomato sauce or whatever and it was AMAZING! I think its my favorite tasting pasta I have ever tasted, and its vegan! so happy!
author: Dallas H.

description:
I believe the first thing I got at Pasta Moto when this portion of the mall opened was pasta. I thought I would get a mountain of pasta considering how much I spent but upon receiving my small bowl of such, I was a bit disappointed. The pasta was way too mediocre for the price. But given my unnatural love for bastardized Italian food, I decided to give this place a second try.

I got a pizza on my second trip and it was fantastic. I think between me and my boyfriend, we've tried all the pizzas and they're nothing but delicious. For the first few weeks this place was open, the amount of toppings on the pizza was inconsistent but I believe they've found their groove by now. Also, those scary sandwiches that peek from the display case while you're in line to pay.. they're actually good! It's amazing.

Don't bother spending money on bottled water here, however. Sometimes they have a cooler of iced water on the other side of the dessert display. Or you can just ask for a cup and fill it up at the water fountain a stone's throw away.
author: Grace-Monday B.

description: I think this place is such a rip off ! It's basically just pasta , cheese , and tomato sauce and that is going to cost you like $10 . If you want to add mushroom or sausage , you had to add money . I mean c'mon ... you go to any Italian restaurant and their pasta comes with some kind of meat or something !! The selection of pasta here is very poor . There didn't seem to have much flavor either so I just compensated with some dry red chili pepper which sure helped to enhance the flavor . The garlic bread tasted alright ... not bad .
author: Eileen L.

description: I wanted pizza and I wanted it bad! So where does one go when you're in a mall like that of Westfield? Well they have the norm of fast food at any other mall and then they have this upscale version bottom level outside of Bristol Farms. There were a handful to choose from and I went with the mushroom one.  It was delicious and soft and I really enjoyed all the ingredients on it. Even my parents enjoyed it and they don't really like pizza. I took my meal home but they do give dining plates for eating there at the mall. I will be back when I return to San Francisco!
author: Tiffany A.

description:
Being in the mall, this has the ability of being under the guise that it will be shitty food.

But the Westfield in SF, has a food court that can hide a few hidden gems.

I first stepped across Pasta Moto because I tried their cheese pizza. And I was hungry. But me and companions thought to circulate and make the best decision. But we came back to Pasta Moto.

The service was oddly cold and the exterior tacky. They make it prominent that their pasta is "al dente." And it all holds true. The food was good, it definitely hit some taste buds. However, the service was cold, the cashier couldn't afford to break a smile. She has this cold bleak exterior that made the yellow on the walls feel like it was jaundice on someone's skin. You can still provide service when being a cashier, in fact it's easier than being a server. And I didn't really feel compelled to drop her some money for service and for that she was rude.

But it did it's purpose. I had the penne pomodoro with chicken and sprinkled some chili flakes. It was superb. I would make this an option if I ever find myself at Westfield again, for sure. I'm sure if this place explodes it will deteriorate like Pasta Pomodoro. But until then, it's going to give it a run for it's marinara, I mean money...
author: Kim D.

description: First off, this place is way overpriced. My friend and I got two stellas and a pizza - it ended up being about $12.50 a head. The pizza was great flavor-wise but poorly made - our toppings kept falling off the crust onto our plate (imagine just a slice of pizza dough with tomato sauce). Could have done with a thicker crust pizza but that's just me and my carboholicism speaking. I guess that's what you get eating in a mall....:(
author: Peter C.

description: Ordered the ravioli and pasta del giorno and got two people full. Ravioli was ok but the pasta del giorno was really good. Everything sold separately no combo or meals. It really sucked because we wanted a small salad. The total was about 30 bucks...are we in a resturant ?.....oh never mind...just the mall
author: Johnson B.

description:
This is totally fancy mall food court! (Although...makes you kinda miss places like Hot Dog on a Stick and Chick Fil'A)

Anyways, regarding Pasta Moto, I think the for the price...you probably expect it to be really really good. But it's still a mall food court, don't forget!

My brother ordered a grilled veggie panini & I ordered the chicken.  Both were decent although my chicken panini could've used more sauce. They serve Terra chips on the side.

Some positive points are that it's convenient that they can give a pager to beep when the food is ready.  And, you do eat food on real plates rather than Styrofoam or paper plates.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I've had two experiences with this place;

1st)  Was first looking at the Penne Pomodoro, but there was another dish for a different kinda of paste with the spicy sauce.  I didn't know what to pick, so I asked for the Penne with that spicy sauce.  I asked for a drink, when the owner offered me any free side.  Awesome!  

Food was very good, very fast, and the owner was very very very kind!

2nd)  Went with my boyfriend, and he ordered a caesar salad.  There was a small side portion and a large portion, but the owner allowed us to order a "medium."  Awesome!  I ordered a side order of "garlic bread" and got 5 really decent sized pieces.  The caesar salad ended up being the perfect size for the perfect (medium) price and tasted pretty good.

Top notch service, top notch speed, and good food.  What more can I say about this place?
author: Jessica M.

description: The first time I went to this place, I thought my plate spaghetti and meatballs was made by a chef having a bad day. The visuals were glorious but once I sunk my teeth into one of the meatballs, it was quite apparent that the marinara sauce had an off taste. The flavor didn't even taste like spaghetti sauce. No ZEST. Watery and no punch. Yuck. A can of Chef-Boy-Ardee would hand this travesty a serious ass whupping. Sorry. Just the facts. The second time I went, I was ready for forgive and forget. So, I ordered the Chicken and Artichoke Marinara. Wow. To my surprise.....it was the exact same sauce! I have no luck. The water I wash my socks in have more flavor. Never again. My hard-earned $13+ down the drain. My son ordered the pizza and was the pits too. Soggy. Salty. The Four Cheese topping just slid off the crust. C'mon Pasta Moto. Step up your game! I know you're in a mall but YOU'RE IN A MALL IN SAN FRANCISCO! Needless to say, I won't be back. Good luck to all the folks after me :o)
author: Charlie Z.

description: This place is delicious. I work upstairs and always take my break with a panino caprese.
author: Megan W.

description: The food is alright, pretty good for mall food, but not as great as a real Italian place.  It's pretty expensive for what you're getting.  The service is okay, nothing great.  Food comes pretty fast, although I was the only one in line.
author: Christina S.

description: Meeting up for a girls' night to watch Sex and the City 2 and we all needed something in our bellies and hopefully some drinks.  We hit the food court in the mall for something reasonable and along came Pasta Moto.  On Friday night, they have a buy 2 meals and get a bottle of wine for $10.  Needless to say, our group jumped on it.  My friend and I got a cheese pizza and a mushroom pizza - both were delicious.  Our other two friends had pasta and enjoyed their meals.  Obviously the wine was the best part of the meal and it was a great deal for our girls' night.  My only complaint would be that my friend went up there because they gave her the wrong pasta and they made her get back in a big line and pay the difference.  They should have just exchanged it because it was their fault.
author: Arica V.

description: After posting my experience about this location the owner left me a message expressing his concerns.  I ended going back to this place for a quick lunch last week.  The service was much better and the food came out fresh.  I only thought it was fair to update the rating for my second experience.
author: Arron F.

description:
I love arrabiata sauce.

I can't make it that well at home, and its almost always vegan (In Italy I asked for it sense fromaggio and the server told me that putting cheese on it is not a thing that is done.)  It's not to uncommon at fancy places, but I never see it in fast food places.

They had it here.  It was great, maybe a little oily, but good.  Portion was smaller than I needed but not horrible.  Maybe next time i'll try to add mushrooms.
author: Nessie V.

description:
At first, I hated how their menu worked. You order the pasta and then pay more money to add on veggies or meat (grilled chicken, tomatoes, peppers, etc). It just seemed so much more expensive. 

I had their Alfredo pasta with wide flat noodles and added on grilled chicken and peppers & tomatoes & garlic. It came out to about $14, which I thought was a little pricey for mall food. 

But it was delicious!  Decent portions so their was also enough for my friend and I to share.   

And, now that I think about it, customizing your pasta dish is better because you can experiment (sorta). 

I'll probably be back to try the other pasta dishes.
author: Dorothy N.

description:
The service here is outstanding. I believe it was the owner who was at the cash register because he was friendly to everyone. Even to the Asian girl before me who couldn't pronounce the pasta dish. Hah. The bus boy was very nice and thanked me when another customer knocked off a plastic mat off the counter and I picked it up. Even made some small talk with me and said it was nice talking to me. lol

I ordered the spicy pasta, which wasn't very spicy at all. I ordered mushrooms for an extra buck. Can't say that I saw too many mushrooms in the actual pasta. Threw in some dried red pepper flakes into the pasta and it tasted pretty good. Nothing amazing, but I think this place doesn't have enough bang for it's buck. I think I'd pay $5 for what I received rather than $10.

I'd go again to try out their pizzas, which looked pretty good, or their paninis. We'll see.
author: Grace L.

description:
"Meh.  I've experienced better" sums it up for me.

Yes, service was fast and friendly but the pizza itself didn't really do it for me.  I ordered a pizza margarita and it did not meet my expectations.  The crust was so thin it was like having a tortilla for a crust.  They skimped on the cheese and the pizza itself was not tasty.  Pretty much bland.  And for $9 dollars I think I'll have something more satisfying like a tri-tip sandwich next door at the Buckhorn grill.
author: Henry S.

description: I really like going here when I have lunch breaks from school. I always order the Panino Pollo which has chicken, avocado, pesto, and mozzarella. ALL my FAVORITE things! I guess that's why I'm so crazy about it. It comes with a small salad and chips. All this happiness for just $9.31(that's with tax). It fills me up and is very tasty, so it's worth it!
author: Tiffany P.

description:
man, California Crisp made me loveee paninis.. so as i was shopping at sf centre.. i got SUPER hungry and browsed through the food court. so much to choose from! i was instantly drawn to Pasta Moto because they had paninis, and i assumed that it would taste remotely as great as california crisp's. WRONG. :( my pollo chicken sans avocado was SO dry and not very flavorful. i was taking the TINIEST bites ever, when i would usually scarf down my meal.

so disappointing. kinda expensive too. =(
author: Danny P.

description: I've got nothing to complain about. I had the pepperoni pizza which I aboslutely loved, ate the whole thing myself minus one slice. It's thin and tastes great. Service is fast, prices are in the $10 zone. This is totally somewhere I would eat again.
author: Juju B.

description: OH EM GEE!!  The food here is so good.  I was worried when I saw the prepackaged items in there fridge but once i got my chix Parmesan I was in heaven.  It was served with a side of pasta in a creamy cheesy sauce accompanied by roasted veggies.  Oh I ate that food so fast my tummy hurt but it was worth every bite.  I was so happy to get such quality food in a mall, and for more than I would normally pay.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
It's seven o' clock on a Tuesday night. I worked for eight hours drove for two more. I get to the mall. I have been planning this for weeks. I am so tired, but I just want to shop. I want to know what all the hype is about. I'm hungry. Any good shopper knows that food is the fuel that keeps you shopping. I stop for a light bite. Somehow I end up in line getting pasta. I wait. I have to remind myself, this too is just a mall. You have to deal with the crowds. Patience while I am waiting for ten minutes to order a 10 dollar bowl of pasta. I order. I forget the glass of house wine. I wait all over again. Ten more minutes. The credit card machine isn't working for both registers. Five more minutes. I get yet another vibrating number for a glass of wine. I wait for the wine. The order comes up. Completely wrong. My food has to be made still. Everyone eats. I get the wine. My food is ready 10 minutes later. I waited 10 minutes for uncooked hard pasta. And to top it off I only get 6 raviolis. Trust me. I counted them. Man was I pissed. By the time this whole spectacle was over it was eight o' clock. I was pissed. Still hungry. And did NO shopping. 

The only thing good about this place is the two owners of which are very nice. They just don't know the pace of the city yet. They came from Connecticut. Both wanted to give me more wine because of the situation. I just wanted to shop.
author: monika l.

description: I'm suprised this place has got an overall low rating...I think people are missing out on the best items on the menu..the paninis here are the best paninis I've ever had! My absolute favorite the chicken panini, yummy! And they are quick no major wait for food, decently priced and did i mention the chicken paninis? If you've eaten here before and didn't try the panini you must go back!
author: Lea S.

description: I had the tagliatelle with alfredo sauce and a misto salad. I liked it alot - very fresh and the pasta tasted homemade. It was very busy and I only had to wait about 5 minutes. 'Nuff said.
author: Jamie M.

description: since working at mall and last minute decision on what to eat for lunch, i always pick this place. and i only get two items here its either their bomb ass penne panadoro pasta w/ italian sweet sauge or their famous margarita pizza. i always ask for extra cheese and let me tell you, there actually pretty generous with it. their serving is fast and the food is always on point. on the healthy side, you have to worry about the calories. which is a down fall. aside from that they have great customer service and i will continue to order food from here. price is reasonable for italian food though their side order is pricey.
author: Donna S.

description: I never really notice this place, since there are so many options. But today I came by to give it a try. The person who worked here was very friendly, and happy to give his recommendations. He recommended the pasta of the day (something like that) and must I say it was one of the most delicious pastas I've ever had! Usually, the creme sauces can be overwhelming, but not this one. The slices of chicken were so tender and cooked to perfection. The mushrooms, onions and basil were the perfect match! The only thing that could've made it better was if the onions were cut into thinner pieces. We also ordered the garlic bread, which wasn't bad either!!
author: Elaine H.

description: Really yummy four cheeze (quatro formaggio) pizza. Haven't tried anything else here. But if you get the pizza, be forewarned, rich as hell, so share with friends and get something else from one of the other Food Emporium places too to mix it up.
author: Sarah R.

description: I like paninis, but these aren't particularly great. I've ordered the goat cheese panini so far, but will probably try one of the pastas or pizzas next.
author: Matt N.

description: Gosh I wish this restaurant was in the East Bay!  The gnocchi was excellent!  Couldn't be better!  Nice to have a glass of wine in a shopping center!  The seating at the shopping center, Westfield, is way too crowded, which is the only drawback.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I passed by a weekday afternoon when the lines weren't particularly long.  I ordered the prosciutto, pecorino and arugula panino.  The service was slow and I had to wait fifteen minutes for the sandwich.  It arrived on a dirty tray, which a complaint soon resolved, but the staff hadn't bothered to supply napkins or silverware.

As for the food itself- the sandwich and salad were ridiculously small for $8.50 before tax.  The portions at Pasta Pomodoro are at least twice the size and definitely cheaper.  Anyway, the salad was minimal, worse yet because the tomatoes weren't ripe.  The sandwich only had a few thin slices of prosciutto, not enough to taste, and the pecorino was bland.
author: David V.

description: OK Conspiracy Italian food for downtown mall prices. The pizza was really good. The spaghetti puttanesca was really OK. I couldn't taste the anchovies, but the overall quality was plain old fine and filling. Why would you want to eat more pasta than that, anyway? Italian dining style sez you would have a piece of meat or fish with a side vegetable as your next course... not one giant bowl of pasta for your meal. Wake up, America!
author: Amy J.

description: I ordered their penne pasta with a side of cherry tomatoes today and it was under $10 and yummy! The pasta was nice and hot with melted cheese and just the right amount of sauce. I would come here again!
author: Gina H.

description:
i had a good experience here today. great service and food wasnt too bad.  
i come back
author: Mike L.

description: I ordered the house special (don't remember the exact name). It was just like a good Alfredo pasta. I mean, it was good, but I was expecting something better for the price ($11.50 in a food court of the mall). There were only about 5 tiny pieces of chicken, which didn't help either.
author: Wayne T.

description: They fired or all their friendly staff like Christophe left, and now they just have a bunch of douchey mall teenagers working there. The food is nothing special and the service was the only really nice thing about it, but now its just an overpriced mall chain with better, cheaper pizza down the street.
author: Matt C.

description: yummy! great panini's and friendly service.   I had the prosciutto panini and a fanta - - it was great and I will definitely go back!
author: Shannon W.

description: For a mall Italian place, it wasn't too bad.  The man and I had a quick snack before dinner here the other day.  He was craving some Hawaiian pizza, but Pasta Moto didn't make it, so we got a different pizza instead.  They buzzed us pretty quickly so we got the pizza fast.  What was kind of funny was that the man is a pretty picky eater, so he literally picked off all the toppings from the pizza so it ended up just being a cheese pizza.  Which makes me wonder if they make just a cheese pizza so he didn't have to go through all the work of picking off all the toppings.
author: Kris L.

description: OMG....I would never expect such good italian food in a food court setting ever. I got the pasta special mix with tomato and cream sauce as recommended by the cashier and I also paired it up with some nice crispy garlic bread.  The pasta itself contains a great mixture of chicken, mushrooms, basil and onions that created such a great taste it totally knocked my taste buds out.  Kudos to the cooks for making this great meal for me!! Definitely one of the spots I will try to stop by at least once a week to fill in my pasta cravings.
author: Lu Lu L.

description: I love pizza, but I'm lactose intolerant, so I order my pie without cheese, which can be very hit or miss. In malls, this option usually doesn't exist because that giant grease slice is not frequently made to order. Cheeseless pizza can often be a terrible disappointment (think wonder bread flattened with a mallet and rubbed with ketchup) but the crust and sauce here holds up without being drowned in mozzarella. You can get the margherita with roasted vegetables for an extra dollar and you've got an excellent flatbread focaccia. Yeay for the tasty default vegan pizza! Servers are also very friendly. For mall food, yes perhaps its expensive, but for the quality of the pizza, I think the prices are pretty reasonable actually.
author: Hallie R.

description: The thought of mall food makes me want to run away, but this place was actually very good and different from the garden variety mall food.  I took Bart from Fremont and got to the San Francisco shopping center starving for food.  I wanted to find some place nice to eat, but I also didn't want to wait very long.  I ordered one of their thin crust pizzas and it was served lightning fast.  It is a little pricey for mall food, but at least it was good.  The area to sit and eat was crowded an noisy, but that is to be expected in such a high foot traffic area.  I would go back again if I were in the same situation where I was in a rush for decent food.
author: Sherry R.

description: i had a panini. and it tasted pretty good!! which was good. i mean, i went there to eat. but all i got was a panini, a small salad, and a drink, and it was 14 dollars. thats a bit much. i mean. the food was pretty good, but it was in a food court. and my lunch shouldnt have costed that much for that little quantity.
author: Reina S.

description: This place was quite surprising for a fast food eatery. The margarita  pizza I tried was light and delicious. I tried their half salad and found the portion to be quite large. All in all it was great for the price and very healthy.
author: Tricia M.

description:
It's not bad food for a food court. It's actually quite decent, but like every other eatery in that food court, a bit overpriced for what it is.
Also, while I like friendly, courteous service, I do not like complete strangers attempting to flatter me. That said, did not enjoy being called 'babe" and "bella" by total stranger, and a skeezy looking one at that. Call me old fashioned, call me a raging feminist, but I didn't enjoy it.
That said, when I did have a complaint about my experience there, the mangement was very sympathic and had me and a guest come back for a free meal and free glass of wine, which was nice. If only the location manager was there when we went, as he said he would be.
author: A J.

description: decent pasta for mall food. the pastas are tasty and the portions are huge! can't complain.
author: Regina C.

description: Not bad for the pasta, i like the gnocchi. I don't really recommend on the pizza; I order vegetable pizza, the vegetables r too big to put in the pizza, & it didnt tast that great...hmm i think it's ok here...
author: Ms C.

description: Normally mall foods aren't that great, however Pasta Moto wasn't bad.  In consideration for mall food is was actually good.  Service was fast, quantity was fair and was served at a resonable time.
author: susie l.

description: I go to Pasta Moto on my lunch break because the mall is very close to work. I very much enjoy the Alfredo pasta dish and their garlic bread, it actually has chunks of garlic on it. It's not the cheapest for mall food but the quality is excellent.
author: Mala S.

description: This  is not a fast food place! They serve really good pasta and their pizzas are sooo good too! Not salty, just right. Past noodles are cooked just about right too. I would recommend this place over any average Italian restaurants in the city. Definitely will try this place over any other food services in that food court.
author: Julie K.

description: Pasta Moto was just okay for me. I got close to the menu and it must have been obvious that I didn't know what I wanted because the guy came up to me and started telling me about the dishes. His offer was sincere, but I could tell that his descriptions of the dishes was scripted. He could have told me, "hey dude this is some good stuff, it's pizza with tomatoes and garlic and it's okay, but if you want the good stuff try this." but instead he gave me a script with his eyes looking up as though he was trying to think of the rest of the words. Halfway through his rant I decided to order the penne pasta with caesar salad and garlic bread, but he cut me off to whistle at a girl passing by. Dude take my order first THEN whistle at the girls. There will be plenty of girls passing by! The pasta was okay but it lacked Parmesano cheese. The portions were large though so I wasn't able to finish it. Overall I would say give it a shot if you're hungry. It's like Sbarro's but slightly better.
author: Clara M.

description: i've only had the pizza here but it was surprisingly delicious!  you wouldn't expect that from a place called pasta-moto in a mall food court.  i got the pizza rustica (around $10) which has sausage and pepperoni.  it is a thin crust pizza, perfectly made with a crispy outside and chewy inside.  one pizza is a little more than enough for one person.   i highly recommend this pizza, it's the best pizza i've had outside of italy.
author: Bridget C.

description: I love this place! Delicious Italian food done well and quick. The food is fantastic and filling.  The pricing is very fair for both the quality and quantity of food. The staff is very attentive and friendly, making you forget, that you are, in fact, in a mall. Trust me, this is difficult, as I used to work in this mall until very recently!!! And believe me there is only so much crappy pizza, pretzels and greasy Chinese food one can ingest! Good selection of wine to enjoy with your meal and it's open late.  Definitely worth a visit.  :)
author: Anie A.

description: juicy grilled chicken panini with pesto, avocado, arugula, fresh mozzarella and spinach leaves on a crispy ciabata = HEAVEN
author: N. M.
